thread.title: REVEALED: The shortlist for the Western Morning News Business Awards 2017

author: Hannah Finch
title: REVEALED: The shortlist for the Western Morning News Business Awards 2017
text:
The Western Morning News Business Awards celebrate the very best of business in the region Share 
Here it is... the shortlist for the Western Morning News Business Awards 2017 
It has been a great year for great business and the judging panel has had an exceptionally difficult job with the number and quality of entries getting better every year. 
From the Isles of Scilly to the Somerset border - South West businesses big and small are represented here with a wide range of sectors appearing on the shortlist. 
Bill Martin, editor of the Western Morning News said: “This year’s entries were again outstanding illustrating that, despite the challenges of the environment we work in, there’s a real appetite for excellence in the region – and real desire to let the rest of the country know. St.Austell Brewery, winner of Business of the Year. Western Morning News Business Awards 2016 at the Holiday Inn, Plymouth (Image: Matt Gilley) 
“The challenges provided by our geography, and our chronically underfunded infrastructure, have been exacerbated by uncertainty around Brexit. 
“It is at times like this that leadership really counts. That is why it is heartening to see so many businesses in the region that are not only flourishing, but they are doing so with confidence and clarity.” Judging for the Western Morning News Business Awards 2017 Rear: Hannah Finch (WMN Business Editor) George Cowcher (Chief Exec, Devon Chamber of Commerce) Kim Conchie (Chief Exec, Cornwall Chamber of Commerce) Front: Sarah Heald (Director of Corporate Affairs and Investor Relations Pennon) Bill Martin (Editor WMN) and Julia Green (Partner, Browne Jacobson) 
The judging panel, chaired by Mr Martin, included Kim Conchie, chief executive of Cornwall Chamber of Commerce; Sarah Heald, director of corporate affairs and investor relations at Pennon Group ; Julia Green, partner at Browne Jacobson Exeter; Hannah Finch, business editor at the Western Morning News and George Cowcher, chief executive of Devon Chamber of Commerce. 
Pennon Group is the title sponsor for the awards. 
The gala dinner is being held at St Mellion, Saltash, on Thursday, November 16. 
Tickets are now available here . Glamour... at the Princess Yachts display at Cannes 
BUSINESS OF THE YEAR 
sponsored by Pennon Group Plc 
This will be awarded to a profitable, growing business that has a positive impact on the Westcountry’s economy as a whole. 
THE SHORTLIST
